thread.title: Behind the scenes at the Baftas 2017 – in pictures | Film
thread.title_full: Behind the scenes at the Baftas 2017 – in pictures | Film | The Guardian

author: Sarah Lee
title: Behind the scenes at the Baftas 2017 – in pictures | Film
text:
Behind the scenes at the Baftas 2017 – in pictures Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email View more sharing options Share on LinkedIn Share on Pinterest Share on Google+ Share on WhatsApp Share on Messenger Close
With exclusive backstage access, Guardian photographer Sarah Lee captured the stars’ preparations, the parties and the red carpet atmosphere of this year’s British Academy film awards
• Baftas 2017 verdict: Ken Loach’s passion and the La La Land wobble
Sarah Lee
Monday 13 February 2017 11.48 GMT Last modified on Monday 13 February 2017 12.03 GMT
Arrival … Amy Adams enters the Royal Albert Hall for the 2017 British Academy film awards Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Cirque du Soleil provide added theatre on the red carpet Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Ron Howard meets the fans. His film The Beatles: Eight Days a Week was nominated for best documentary Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Stephen Frears, director of Florence Foster Jenkins, arrives. He kept his hat on for the evening Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Aaron Taylor-Johnson, who was nominated as best supporting actor for his role in Nocturnal Animals Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Luke Evans, who appeared in The Girl on the Train Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Eddie Redmayne, who starred in outstanding British film nominee Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Emily Blunt, best actress nominee for The Girl on the Train, signs autographs on the red carpet Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Bafta awards in waiting Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Glamorous guests take their seats Facebook Twitter Pinterest
The seated crowd wait for the royal family before the show can begin Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Presenter Stephen Fry, by now a Bafta institution Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Meryl Streep enjoys the speeches Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Nicole Kidman has a quiet moment backstage Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Ken Loach, whose I, Daniel Blake won the outstanding British film award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Tom Holland takes a moment with his rising star award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Julia Stiles, who presented the award for best documentary Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Emily Blunt and brother-in-law Stanley Tucci wait in the wings before going on stage to present the best adapted screenplay award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Mark Rylance watches the ceremony backstage on a monitor Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Dev Patel who won the supporting actor Bafta for his role in Lion, with Viola Davis who won the supporting actress Bafta for her role in Fences Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Isabelle Huppert applies a little touch up before presenting an award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Simon Pegg adjusts his bow tie while nervously laughing with Nathan Lane about their risque gags on stage presenting Mel Brooks with a fellowship award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Tom Hiddlestone, just after presenting an award, backstage before going into the press area Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Swedish actor Noomi Rapace backstage Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Russell Tovey at the Bafta dinner at Grosvenor House Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Hugh Grant in the wings Facebook Twitter Pinterest
JK Rowling talks to Eddie Redmayne and his wife Hannah Bagshawe Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Best supporting actress Viola Davis, with her husband, Julius Tennon Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Mel Brooks happily clutching his Bafta fellowship award Facebook Twitter Pinterest
It was a long night for Sarah Lee, seen here with Bafta photographer Jonathan Birch, and a horse … Facebook Twitter Pinterest
